pros: There is great leadership there and everyone works very cooperatively.  They make you feel very safe.
cons: There was some theft when I was there.

review_title: Poor leadership led to lay offs and closure of College
pros: Wonderful small college with dedicated professors committed to Detroit area students - often vulnerable, fist time to college. In the 90 s and early 2000s, it’s small classes, day care and strong academic support network led to student success and high graduation rate.
cons: Poor leadership took focus off student learning and support. Leadership, seduced by grant money from large corps, focused on making Marygrove a center for Urban Leadership and took focus off supporting vulnerable students. Student retention dropped, debt accumulated, the nuns panicked, closed College and sold to Kresge.
College closed a few years ago

review_title: My experience at Marygrove College has been one of great growth and contribution to the institute.
job_title: Administrative Assistant for International Programs in Detroit, MI
pros: The reason I thrive at this Institute is the mission and objectives are aligned with the the highest standards and best practices for a higher educational culture.
cons: The primary challenge of all institutions of higher education should be to ensure the success of all participants. 100% is always the goal, and the fight is no student left behind.  The challenge is to make sure all student meet their goal and surpass them.

pros: Very flexible work schedules and relaxed environment.
cons: Theres is absolutely no transparency with the status of the college and its financial status. They rely heavily on individuals without cross training, so others know the job when someone is gone.

pros: Relaxed work environment.  College classes are free for employees.  The campus is beautiful.  The external image of the campus is okay.
cons:
Extremely poor benefits and no perks. Retirement payments reduced dramatically over 6 years ago as a short-term cost savings with a promise to return them.  Promise unfulfilled.  

High staff turnover.  Three presidents in less tan three years. Short staffing all around creates undo hardship on faculty and administrators.  

Lack of diversity in the faculty.

Student enrollment continues to decline.

pros:
Small and easy to make positive impact
Diverse workforce and student body
Commitment to city of Detroit and folks who live there
cons:
Senior management treated employees poorly
Large turnover in staff constant due to cuts and dismissals
Low pay in relation to other higher ed peers

pros:
Hard-working faculty dedicated to mission
Small class  sizes
Beautiful campus
cons:
The College abruptly closed the undergraduate program and terminated faculty.  
Not enough resources or qualified faculty to continue the graduate school. 
Teacher Certification program has lowest rating  by Michigan Department of Education.

review_title: Nice place to work. Holiday pay and school breaks were great
pros: Holiday and school breaks were great. Nice office setting.
cons: No job security- you never know when you will get laid off.

pros: I love working here because of the students.
cons: The management was rude, and didn't know how to talk to people.
Not a lot of room for advancement

pros: Culture, encouragement, growth, disicipline, great memories, and great friends.
cons: This school is not in arizona
